text: Ecuador competed at the 2016 Summer Paralympics in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, from 7 September to 18 September 2016. The team consisted of five athletes, four men, one woman, and one male sighted guide. ==Athletics== Darwin Castro and guide Sebastian Rosero ;Men's Track {|class=wikitable style="font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Events !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Final |- !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Damian Carcelen |align=left rowspan=2|400 m T20 |51.68 |4 Q |51.80 |8 |-align=center |align=left|Ronny Santos Iza |54.41 |5 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Darwin Castro (Guide – Sebastian Rosero) |align=left|1500 m T11 |4:21.29 |3 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|5000 m T11 |colspan="2" |16:25.38 |7 |} ;Men's Field {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |-align=center !Athlete !Events !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Damian Carcelen |align=left rowspan=2|Long Jump F20 |5.87 |12 |-align=center |align=left|Ronny Santos Iza |6.74 |7 |-align=center |align=left|Stalin Mosquera |align=left|Shot Put F20 |14.79 |6 |} ;Women's Field {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |-align=center !Athlete !Events !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Poleth Mendes Sanchez |align=left|Shot Put F20 |12.02 |5 |} == See also == *Ecuador at the 2016 Summer Olympics == References == Category:Nations at the 2016 Summer Paralympics 2016 Category:2016 in Ecuadorian sport
title: Ecuador at the 2016 Summer Paralympics
